humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand ", " big " sound, the original meaning is to resist. "Sun Tzu-Nine Lands": "The beginning is like a virgin, and the enemy opens an account; afterwards, like a rabbit, the enemy is too late to refuse."

" Refusal " can be extended as evidence. "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms" Chapter 16: "Wei You refused to the wall."

" Reject " can mean rejection. "The Analects of Confucius-Zizhang": "Those who can do with them, but those who cannot refuse."

" Refusal " can also mean arrival or arrival. "Book of Sui-Biography of the Western Regions-Dangxiang": "Lin Tao and Xiping in the east, and Yehu in the west."

" Reject " also means closing. Tang Shen Yazhi's "Feng Yan Biography": "Yan waits in the room, and reverts to bed."

" Refusal " also means stretching. "Han Feizi·Yangquan": "If you count the trees, you can refuse the branches outside; if you refuse the branches outside, you will force the master." Chen Qiyou's collection of explanations: "I still say not to refuse the branches outside."

" Reject " also refers to a square matrix. "Zuo Zhuan‧ Huan Gong Five Years": "Zheng Ziyuan, please be the Cai and Wei people for the left, and Chen for the right." Du's note: "Rejection, the phalanx."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand " and " ju " sound, the original meaning is to resist.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「巨」聲，本義為抵禦。《孫子‧九地》：「是故始如處女，敵人開戶；後如脫兔，敵不及拒。」

　　「拒」可引申為據守。《三國演義》第16回：「韋猶死拒寨門。」

　　「拒」可表示拒絕。《論語‧子張》：「可者與之，其不可者拒之。」

　　「拒」還可表示抵、到。《隋書‧西域傳‧黨項》：「東接臨洮、西平，西拒葉護。」

　　「拒」也表示關閉。唐沈亞之〈馮燕傳〉：「燕伺得間，復偃寢中，拒寢戶。」

　　「拒」還表示伸展。《韓非子‧揚權》：「數披其木，無使木枝外拒；木枝外拒，將逼主處。」陳奇猷集釋：「猶言勿使木之枝向外拒出。」

　　「拒」亦指方陣。《左傳‧桓公五年》：「鄭子元請為左拒以當蔡人、衛人，為右拒以當陳人。」杜預注：「拒，方陣也。」
